item.title: salesforce.com: Lead Product Manager, Monitoring & Management Tools (financial district)
item.description:
Description: Salesforce.com is the enterprise cloud computing company. Our portfolio of Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) applications, including our award-winning customer relationship management (CRM), has revolutionized the ways that customers manage and share business information over the Internet. Salesforce.com has evolved from a startup founded by four people in a cramped San Francisco apartment ten years ago to a company described by Barrons as the fastest growing business software company in the world. With more than 3,000 employees, over $1B in annual revenues, and over a million users worldwide, we are proud to contribute to the success of companies of all sizes, in all industries, around the globe. According to Gartner, 25% of all software will be deployed via the cloud computing model by 2011. No matter how you slice it, the future of software is cloud computing. Consider joining the cloud computing leader, Salesforce.com, and be part of the team that is creating this future.

Salesforce.com provides a compelling opportunity for Technologists to build innovative apps and to make an immediate impact to over a million users worldwide, all while working at a rapid growth company with unlimited career opportunities in downtown San Francisco. Are you interested in contributing, creating and participating with an organization defining the game-changing technology of SaaS (Software as a Service)? How about working within a technology-driven organization that continually innovates the implementation of Agile software development?

Are you excited about the opportunity to influence the software industry by being involved with visionary technologies and business ideas like APEX, PaaS (Platform as a Service), and the App Exchange? How about working on a system that performs over 180 million transactions per day? If your answer is yes to any of these questions, this is your opportunity to join a dynamic Technology team at salesforce.com, the market leader in cloud computing. Top technologists across the world join us for our change the world mentality; the opportunity to excel in a fast-paced, performance-based environment and the chance to be surrounded by peers and leaders that inspire, motivate, and innovate.

Our Technology team is looking for an experienced and visionary technical product manager to lead and drive the vision, strategy and delivery of the monitoring and management products, frameworks and tools to scale the systems and application monitoring capabilities (as well as systems/application management) for Salesforce.com  the leader in SaaS and Cloud Computing delivering over 200M transactions a day to over 1 million subscribers. This leadership role has a key responsibility for guiding the future of salesforce.com's service by delivering world class systems and applications monitoring and management. This opportunity is a fantastic challenge for an energetic, ambitious and innovative individual who is an expert in this technology space and thrives on working in and driving a cross-functional/enterprise team. Salesforce.com continues to experience tremendous growth in every metric - customers, subscribers, web and API transactions, page views - and has just deployed the 28th generation of its industry leading software!

Responsibilities:

* Define and deliver a long-term vision and product roadmap that covers systems and applications monitoring (and eventually
* Gather, drive, collaborate, consolidate requirements from cross-functional and geographically dispersed organizations across various technology and operational disciplines.
* Following Agile best practices, define the requirements as small, achievable, deliverable. prioritized user stories on the appropriate product backlog.
* Manage the multiple product backlogs as a single, prioritized virtual backlog.
* To facilitate collaboration and communication, travel is required between Salesforce offices in Florida and Virginia.
* Own and drive these prioritized user stories across multiple development and operations teams to deliver on the roadmap on a monthly/quarterly basis.
* Provide detailed atchitecture/systems specifications using the most current analysis/diagramming/design tools to represent business processes.
* Deliver on wide range of functional requirements covering the entire tools user space which can range from Tier-1/Level-1 operations thru Tier-5/Level-5 engineering and up thru executive dashboards and reports.
* Actively solicit and synthesize requirements from external customers, and numerous internal customers/business units to provide a rich and prioritized product backlog.
* Coordinate and manage the overall release priorities for the cross-functional team and monitor progress of release activity.
* Define a strategy to extend the tools access and/or performance data visibility to our customer base in a secure manner as part of the companys goal to deliver system and application availability and performance transparency to our customers.
* Build appropriate business cases to justify engineering resources needed to sustain current tools, filling the functional feature/tools gaps, refactoring/replacing existing tools where required, and delivering on the vision.
* Own and drive feature delivery end-to-end: planning, design, prototyping, collaboration with other teams such as R&D and technical publications, operational deployment, training and rollout communication.
* Represent company and provide monitoring expertise in customer interactions, marketing events and user conferences.
* Understand how our customers are monitoring Salesforce.com availability, reliability and performance on their own and how we can improve/extend our internal monitoring suite to our customers.
* Stay abreast of industry-leading trends and tools and drive Salesforce.com to have the best possible monitoring framework so that we can continue to deliver world-class service to our customers as we continue up our incredible growth curve.
* Leverage your leadership, architecture and product management skills and to be a passionate visionary for this space both inside of and outside the company.

Required Skills/Experience:

* 5+ years of experience in systems/application monitoring product management and engineering of large, fault-tolerant, highly scalable applications in a SaaS environment.
* 3+ years of technical Product Management experience.
* Experience in hosted/SaaS/Cloud Computing services.
* Must have Subject Matter Expertise in a broad spectrum of monitoring and management software products, understand industry standards, direction and trends.
* Experience in decisions that balance tactical enhancements and investment in legacy software with driving the cross-functional teams towards the vision.
* Experience working with vendors and vendor processes (RFCs, RFPs, SoWs, etc.) to drive solutions with a balanced buy vs. build vs. integrate strategy.
* Experience managing (with minimal direction) highly complex projects or multiple low complexity projects composed of team members from multiple organizations/enterprises that are geographically dispersed across the U.S.
* Proven ability to deliver on commitments.
* Proven experience working closely with Operational teams.
* Strong troubleshooting and analytical thinking skills.
* Able to adapt to and drive rapid changes in product direction.
* Excellent oral and written communication skills with the ability to tailor communications to various levels of technical and non-technical management.
* Bachelors degree; MBA and technical disciplines/certifications preferred.

Desired Skills:

* Experience with application and systems management tools (e.g., Bladelogic, VMWare Virtual Center).
* Experience with Agile/Scrum development methodology.
* Knowledge of EMC Smarts, Hyperic HQ, Coradiant network appliance, Oracle Statspack.
* Knowledge of SNMP.
* Knowledge of other industry-leading third-party and opensource software products - CA, HP OpenView, Tivoli, BMC, Nagios, etc.

Salesforce.com is an invigorating and stimulating place to work. We were named in early 2009 as one of FORTUNEs 100 Best Companies to Work For. The best-of-the-best work side by side every dayaddressing challenges and providing the opportunity for each of us to do the best work of our careers. If you are ready to become a key contributor and join one of todays hottest, market-leading companies, then send us your resume/CV and accomplishments today. In return for your efforts, salesforce.com offers a competitive compensation package including on site yoga, healthy snacks, paid-time-off for volunteering and more. Principals only, no agencies please. At salesforce.com, equal talent always means equal opportunity.

PLEASE APPLY ONLINE AT: http://www.salesforce.com/company/careers/locations/a0800000000Ab4cAAC/a017000000DrI2bAAF.jsp
